job_description: This position is limited to students that are registered in a recognized Co-op or Intern Program at a Canadian College or University  Join the team that's transforming the way the world communicates!!As a global leader in fixed, mobile and converged broadband access, carrier and enterprise IP technologies, applications, and services, Alcatel-Lucent offers the end-to-end solutions that enable compelling communications services for people at home, at work and on the move.This position is within the LTE/4G Hardware Radio Development Team, working on state of the art transceiver design for use in commercial communications. Key Job Responsibilities:Support High Power Amplifier Linearization with Digital Pre Distortion.Support High Power Amplifier Build, Test and Design activities.Support LTE Radio System Integration.Perform LTE Radio System Level Design Verification TestDevelop Labview code to test LTE Radio Systems
job_requirements: Education: Essential:• Minimum 2 years BsC, MsC or a PhD in Electrical Engineering. Desired:• 4 years BsC or MsC Student Skills and Experience: Essential (some of the following): Experience in PA or RF Circuit Design, Test and Debug activities.Familiar with Simulation tools like ADS/AWR.Familiar with Matlab programming.Familiar with RF measurement equipment (i.e. Spectrum analyzer, VNA, RF , Signal Generators etc) Desired (some of the following): Electronic and Circuit Theory.Microwave Engineering Theory, Experience in RF Circuit Design and Tests.Experience in RF Circuit Simulation Tools like ADS/AWR and Labview.Familiar with Test Equipments; VNA, Spectrum Analyzer, Load Pull.Practical experience with soldering and building electronic circuits. Alcatel-Lucent Canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage women, Aboriginal persons, persons with a disability or members of a visible minority group to apply. Open To All Majors:No
